definition.name: NXpeak
definition.doc: Description of peaks, their functional form or measured support.

symbols.doc: The symbols used in the schema to specify e.g. dimensions of arrays.

field.name: label
field.doc: Human-readable identifier to specify which concept/entity the peak identifies.

field.name: peak_model
field.doc: Is the peak described analytically via a functional form or is it described empirically via measured/reported intensity/counts as a function of an independent variable.

field.name: position
field.doc: In the case of an empirical description of the peak and its shoulders, this array holds the positions were independent variable values were taken.

field.name: intensity
field.doc: In the case of an empirical description of the peak and its shoulders, this array holds the intensity/count values at each position.

group.doc: In the case of an analytical description this group can be used to hold parameter of the functional form. For example in the case of Gaussian peaks mu, sigma, and cut-off values and background intensity.
